This is going to be sit pretty and what you
want with sit pretty is to get them to go

up on their hind quarters. With bigger dogs
this is a little bit more difficult but you

can use a wall so they don't tip over, some
dogs you can just kind of teeter totter in

to it. This is also something that's really
good to exercise your dogs core muscles so

if you have a dog that's in agility or in
any kind of sporting event you can get their

muscles and their core all warmed up. How
you would start this would basically get a

nice "sit" and then take your treat and lift
it over their head, you want to see the feet

come off the ground. You want to take them
little steps tell them "pretty" "good boy."

As they get good at it you can start getting
it a little bit further over their head and

with the big dogs they tend to tip a little
bit. "sit, good boy." Then you can add a hand

signal. A hand signal can be anything like
this "good boy" then you hold it there and

you get a "stay." If you want to take it to
the next level and get a little bit of a stretch

over it you can get a "sit pretty" and bring
them up and that gets a little bit of an exercise

title: Dog Tricks : Sitting Pretty Dog Trick
